Reviews.Title: Good digital camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Tom B.
Reviews.Content: I mostly shoot film, but a good digital camera is good to have. And this is a good digital camera, especially for the price.Out of the box you get the camera, charging cable, battery, and USB computer cable.  Not included is a secure digital (SD) card. You'll have to get that. A 1 gig SD will set you back only $20 and is a worthy investment, enabling you to take anywhere between 300-1,000 pics.The camera is pretty basic, but has some nice features.  A slider bar on the back lets you choose between still shots, movies (saved in AVI files) and view photo mode.Easy to navigate menu button and four way navigation button enable you navigate the menus, choosing photo size, red eye removal, and cropping and photo border options.There are also advanced photo options letting you choose between portrait, landscape, night, sunset, and action shooting modes.Pictures take quickly and there is only about a half second shutter lag.I do not have anything to say about the HP software. I don't use it. I use a Mac, and iPhoto. Hooking up the camera to your Mac in this way automatically downloads photos and movies to iPhoto.The pictures are clear and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: HP - R742  Camera - Performance and Value - A great deal
Reviews.Author: Happy With HP
Reviews.Content: My recent purchase of the HP R742 Camera turned out to be a fantastic experience.  I have researched many cameras before deciding.  This camera represents and wonderful value filled with performance of higher priced cameras. Size was a major consideration for me but the other features packed into this small wonder are excellent.  The red eye removal,  the cropping function, ability to select "shooting modes" quickly worked great.  Picture quality is outstanding as well as the optics.I recently took the camera on vacation to Florida.  It fit nicely into my pants pocked and shirt pocket.I have since purchased a "PDA holder" to click on my belt.Great product.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Musk "Pothagorus"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a neat little guy.  I have a Nikon CoolPix 880 (a 3.3mp digital which is going on 7 years old) and I thought I would upgrade.  The CoolPix still works great, so my wife will use it around the house for shooting the kids.At least one review of this product seems to be from someone who expects too much from a piece of technology in this price range. One of the complaints is that the pictures come out dark.  Well, if you are shooting in poor lighting conditions and relying on the little flash on the camera to make up the difference then of course you will have dark pictures. But that is where Photo Shop or an equivalent program comes in handy.There are very few settings that can be changed.  In contrast my 880 can have just about every aspect customized.  However, keep in mind that the r742 is a point-and-shoot, not an SLR replacement.  There are a number of preset shooting modes that optimize shutter speeds and aperture settings for the most common shooting environments.  They seem to work very well.Here are some of the wonderful camera features. I can remove red-eye from the pictures from within the camera. The camera itself has a design gallery which lets me add frames, change color, rotate, and crop.  There is a slide-show setting. It takes movies (more on that later).  NOTE: Anytime you are modifying a picture, the camera makes a duplicate of the original picture and applies the changes to the duplicate. The original is still intact.  Also note that when editing an image within the camera, some functions will take more time than others.  One of the longest is red-eye removal.On a 2gb SD card and the camera set to full resolution I can shoot over 700 pictures.  This camera is SD/SDHC compatible.  I'm looking forward to putting in the 8gb SDHC (make sure you get a SDHC compatible card reader if you are getting an SDHC. Transferring files via the supplied USB cable is fine for a small number of pictures, but it can take a long time to transfer for large numbers of files, and you will use up your battery trying to do so).  I don't need that much storage, but the cards are cheap, so why not?  On a side note, the camera only seems to be able to count to 2000.  When looking at various quality settings, it did not matter how low I set the quality, the camera only showed 2000 as the number of photos it could take on that card.  It seems to me that a firmware update is in order.The pictures come out wonderful. I have taken some indoor pictures and the images are clear and sharp.  Of course, as I mentioned earlier, the quality will depend greatly on ambient lighting conditions and, if using the flash, how close you are to the subject(s).Now to the only negative I have about the camera: the movie feature.  It seems like it is a great feature to capture a quick moment,  but it shoots at 24fps and at 320x240 dpi, which is fine for a camera. What is bad is the audio quality.  But, let's face it, folks.  This is a Point-And-Shoot still image camera, not a camcorder.  It doesn't claim to be a camcorder replacement, nor does it even really use its video capabilities as a gimmick to draw attention to itself.  It's more of a "I take unbelievably stunning photos (and by the way, I can also shoot some video)" kind of camera.  If you want digital video capabilities in a handy little package, go get yourself a Flip Video.All-in-all, I highly recommend this camera.  It's ease of use and excellent picture quality make it worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with 7MP at this low price
Reviews.Author: H. Chen "eman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife as she just wants to have a digital camera and only thing she needs is to "push the button down", the camera is very easy to operate. Especially with such low price (I paid $127.00).The only thing I found Amazon only supply one color, however, HP does make three different color for this camera, I would like to have black color if it is available on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Easiest digital camera!
Reviews.Author: A. Johnson "children's book lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 78 yr. old mother because she wanted a camera that wasn't too difficult to use. This is the one! You don't even have to read the manual to use it. It's self explanitory. Literally! It has a feature that shows on the viewer whether you are taking a picture or viewing a picture. All features are easily marked and easy to read. It's light weight, which was important to my mom who has terrible arthritis in her arms. She loved that she didn't have to raise the camera all the way up to her eyes. She just looks into the very generous view screen! It takes great photos too, by the way. And no, my mom didn't have a problem with the fact that the camera goes into "sleep mode" after only 15 seconds. She just touches a button and the camera comes back to life. No biggie. Too bad not all digital cameras are this simple to use.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT -  GREAT PRICE !
Reviews.Author: N. Ramjohn
Reviews.Content: I first saw a relative with the M447, and thought this camera was great! This inspired me to look for the same item, but then as I looked I saw the R742 and said, I had to get it...coz I do printing on a large scale...so clarity in my photos was necessary and extremely important to me. I have absolutley no regrets with my purchase and even more with the speed of delivery after purchase. FANTASTIC PRICE !

Reviews.Title: HP Camera
Reviews.Author: Alina
Reviews.Content: Not bad. Just as all the reviews said. The screen is a little grainy...just a smidge! But it does not affect overall picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a low price!!!! This is worth your Money!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Y. Jones
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great product and a great buy!!! I received this as a Christmas gift from my mother and I haven't put it down!The camera is slim and sleek in size. It's small but is has a crystal clear viewing screen so you can see all of your pictures while you're snapping away. I was worried the when I got it, I would have a small screen where I could barely view my pictures. But the screen is big, and as I said before it is very clear! It comes with a rechargeable battery, USB cable and wall charger. You can charge the camera from your computer or you can plug the battery charger into the wall. It has a red eye feature that lets you take the red eye out of any picture you take. And you can add frames and or change the color, (Black & White or Sepia) and you can view a slide show right from your camera! You can even crop photos from the camera with out any special programs on you computer. It has a self timer, time and date, and a video camera mode. The images are EXTREMELY CLEAR! I started using it right out of the box Christmas morning. I haven't read the instructions because the camera is really easy to use. If you buy a 1 Gig memory card with it, it will hold over 800 images (And no I am NOT

Reviews.Title: great camera for pic taking mom
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Mullins "KC mom"
Reviews.Content: I love to take pictures of my two girls.  This camera is great for my purposes.  It takes great pictures.  Also, my video camera is not working and for little clips - its really quite good.  The only drawback is sometimes there is a delay in taking pics and sometimes the pics are too dark.  very possibly - this is my fault b/c I have not read all the directions.  I'd recommend it to all parents with a fondness for capturing their childrens' moments.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Randy E. Ryan
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera.  Just what I was looking for.  Point and shoot. Great photos.  Very good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for five months and I love it.  It is compact, very easy to use and I will never use another digital camera that requires double A batteries!!  However, I did find out that taking timer pictures runs a battery down very quickly.  No problem.  It takes only an hour and a half to recharge it.  This camera has MANY shooting modes and shows all the information that you need on the screen.

Reviews.Title: My GREAT new camera
Reviews.Author: B. Crayton "Easyflow1954"
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. Everyone remarks about how professional and sharp my pixs are. I took shots at the pool, at work, and at church. I even posted video on Youtube the first week. I was shocked at the small size of this camera and it is so light weight, but this little camera can produce such high quality of photographs. I feel a little tingle inside every time someone says something about my shots. I also think it is the way I crop and improve the shots on the HP grogram. I have not advanced to the Snapfish site yet but I will get there. I am looking forward to using this great camera for years. I was so impressed with this camera that I sent one to my Nephew for his high school graduation.

Reviews.Title: Big Bang For The Buck
Reviews.Author: J. Hartman
Reviews.Content: Bought this little camera for my wife for Christmas in 07.  She really loves it and the Ruby Red color. She has had no problems using it and the picture quality is really good for a little camera. The battery life is great also. I highly recommend this camera for it's ease of use and utility.

Reviews.Title: camera "upgrade"
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is great. The color qualities, though come out kind of funny. Nothing that a little computer touching up can't fix, though. And do not buy the HP slim case to go with it. The camera is too small. It makes the case seem big and bulky.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jillian "foxy1er"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift for my mother. She already has two of them and absolutely loves them. She had heard that the camera was discontinued and wanted more in other colors in case something happened to the ones she already has. I haven't used it, but she absolutely LOVES it. Enough to want three of them! :)

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: AmazinGrace
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for @ a year when the lens suddenly wouldn't retract.  I tried troubleshooting as recommended on the hp site.  The problem was not resolved.  I then made a phone call to hp.  They were only willing to support my problem with a fee.  I declined.  HP has a very disappointed customer.

Reviews.Title: Bad quality
Reviews.Author: Elaine Rosario "Elaine Rosario"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for a friend and only lasted for a few months, one day she was taking photos and when she turned it off, the lens kept outside and won't  close, and it is still like that ever since. I don't recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Christina Lajoie
Reviews.Content: Worst camera ever. Pictures are dark, I've had it replaces 5 times, customer service is extremely poor and same error every time, charging battery and with a full battery nonetheless, which means you have to wait at least 60 seconds in between pictures. Very annoying, never would buy again

Reviews.Title: Really bad camera
Reviews.Author: John B. Harkavy
Reviews.Content: My daughter has had two of these cameras. Both broke within two months. HP replaced both but since camera is now discontinued, I am not surprised it has been phased out.  Go elsewhere for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Poor product service from HP
Reviews.Author: Reader Cat "Reader Cat"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera and I've been delighted, but guess what?  It's now no longer available and neither is a replacement charger for the battery.  My charger got misplaced when we moved, and I thought, no problem I'll just go to the HP site and reorder.  The charger is not available; no picture of it anywhere, no suggestion of an alternate item to buy.  The online help referred me to the HP Parts store page, no mention of it there either. My opinion of HP has changed...they do not stand by their products.

Reviews.Title: Nice Pocket Camera, Lost over my old HP727
Reviews.Author: A. Hinkle
Reviews.Content: I purchased the R742 about two months ago, the red version. The color is very nice (it's not a magenta red like the pictures may show). The camera color doesn't matter that much though, so let's get to the real issues. Photo quality is quite good, I have no problems with graininess, lines, color issues, etc. As far as this is concerned, it is exactly what I would expect from a camera in this price bracket ($0-$250). Sure, you can't do as much with it as you could with  a higher end camera or a SLR, but then again, look at the price you're paying.Pros:1) It is nice and small, very easy to slide into a pocket or purse to have on hand.2) While 3x zoom (the other 7x is digital and not worth anything) is not much, it works for being a small camera and seems pretty standard.3) The price is inexpensive, yet is a nice low-end camera.4) The click-to-snap time is less than a second I find (i.e. the time between when I press the button, it figures out the exact focus, sets off flash, and "snaps" the shot) which is better than my prior camera which seemed to delay things longer.5) The 7 MP is plenty for nice shots even if I want to enlarge to greater than 8 x 10.Things I don't like, but you may, and things I find different between the R742 and my older R727:1) The R742 power button is a bit hard to press the way it is buried. I have a medium hand size with dexterous fingers, but even I have to press it twice sometimes. The good thing about this though is you don't accidentally turn it on when it's in your pocket! However, my old R727 I sometimes turn on by accident.2) The R742 button to switch between taking and viewing photos is a "slide" button. It seems a bit flimsy, and although I have not had a problem with it I much prefer my older HP727 that had the buttons for this on the top that you press as it is easier to toggle between the two while taking photos.3) The lens moves out when turned on - now this is normal for a lot of cameras, but coming off of my HP727 that did not have an external lens (yet still had 3x optical, 7x digital zoom!), this has taken getting used too.4) On my old HP727, the buttons for setting focus and flash are right on the camera, but now I have to scroll through two menus to get to this; which is annoying when I want to pull this new HP742 out for a quick shot. Now, instead of less than 2 seconds to select focus range and flash setting, it takes about 10. This is a huge difference, for example, if I see some birds, or deer, etc that I want a picture of before they fly/run off.Summary:Over the course of more than two years, I would think that there should be improvements on the R742 from the older versions of pretty much the same model (i.e. my old R727). In reality, the easy usability backslid in those 2+ years, and features (The 1 MP better and faster click-to-snap time) made only tiny strides. If my menu/"ok" button on the R727 constantly worked I would have returned this R742 immediately, as the above two mentioned strides do not make up for the usability issues I have with it.I just went on HP's site, and did not find this camera nor very many others listed. I wonder if they are not going to make cameras any longer. I really like HP products; my desktop (HP D4100E from 2005 and still going strong, no problems at all), laptop (newly purchased TX2000z), printer/scanner/fax (C7280), and camera are all HP. However, this most recent purchase has me wishing I went with a Cannon, or had just waited until I have enough money for a Nikon SLR. I think HP has lost the market on their cameras, and based on their website, they know it.

Reviews.Title: got this for my mom and she loved it
Reviews.Author: MalibuKLW "book lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product for my mom, so my only experience with it is in teaching her how to use it.  I wanted something small and portable, which it is, quite a bit smaller than my own cannon powershot.  It has all the features that my mom would need for basic pictures and it was quite easy for her to learn to use (she is still trying to figure out the internet so that says a lot!)  transferring pictures was easy for her and she hasn't called me yet with any questions.price was also great, i think i paid about half of the suggested price which  adds to the stars!

Reviews.Title: wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Olga M
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this product after about two years with my Pentax Optio E10 (which I do not recommend at all). So far I can't really complain. I like that it has the stabilizing feature which in turn makes the pictures come out clear. I also like that it has the design gallery which allows you to edit pictures without the computer. I only had two problems with this camera.  For one, the dial that is used to switch from shooting  to video mode etc. was a little bit loose. The other thing was the battery life. When using the flash constantly, the battery doesn't seem to last long. Other than that this is a great camera. Most importantly the pictures turn out bright and clear. I highly recommend this product to anyone!

Reviews.Title: A sweet little camera
Reviews.Author: Marang
Reviews.Content: I love my HP742 Digital Camera and the spectacular photographs I get with it. I can choose from a variety of shooting modes and even take high quality video with audio. It is a great looking, sturdy camera with an easy to understand menu packed with features. It has 16MB of internal memory plus an SD card slot included. I chose HP when I was ready to upgrade because my entry level HP Digital has been amazing through the years. I chose Amazon because I feel they put their customers first, and I have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: It's great for a personal Camera
Reviews.Author: Michelle J. Diehl
Reviews.Content: It's great for a personal camera. If you'r wanting it to take absolutely profesional pictures, you might want to invest is a more expesive camera, but for the price it's at it's wonderful. It's not heavy and bulky and it can fit right into my purse or bag. It's easy to figure the buttons. The one thing that I don't like about it, is you set the camera for anti-shakiness, you have to reset it after every take. I love it, and I defenitely think it's a wonderful product from HP. It also seem to be built better than most.

Reviews.Title: Great first digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Taylor
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for a first time user or someone who just wants a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Transaction
Reviews.Author: C. White
Reviews.Content: Simple point and shoot with not too many manual settings.  I would prefer more, but it does take very good, sharp pictures.

Reviews.Title: Viewfinder only stays on for 15 sec
Reviews.Author: Lee W. Young "LeeFoo@verizon.net"
Reviews.Content: We are stunned. We bought this after reading glowing reviews. Not one of them here or other sites mentioned that the viewfinder goes black after 15 seconds! Sure, you can hit a button and bring it back on but that's annoying. None of the other cameras that I tested up at a local big box store went dark sooner than a minute. Even the HP R472 up there went dark after 20 seconds. This is very annoying when on vacation and you have the right pic lined up and it goes dark. There's not even an option to change it!I spoke with HP and they said this was a Hardware problem. So, they sent me another. It, too goes off in 15 seconds.I don't think it is a hardware problem. I think it is a camera problem. How this got reviews of 7.0 and up, I will never know. We just wanted a simple, basic camera. Kinda hard to take pix, when the viewfinder is always going dark on you.LeeFoo@verizon.net

Reviews.Title: newer models are available now
Reviews.Author: Poseidon
Reviews.Content: at the time this was top of the line, now there are better cameras out there, but it was inexpensive and worked.

Reviews.Title: My second every Camera
Reviews.Author: Paineverlasting
Reviews.Content: I've actually had this camera for a few years, and for the most part it does me well. I actually got this for my birthday when I was about 15- and that was 5 years ago. The only area that I really have trouble around is the aquarium. Mostly because of all the glass- It's just really hard to keep it there. And I wish that when you picked the night mode that it would keep it on. I hate having to go back all the time and turn it back on. I miss to many good pictures having to do this. But for the most part? It's really good. charge holds pretty well. Voice is really good. I wish the camera would hold the light on while you took videos, but can't have everything... But still- if you just need something for going about here or there- I recommend this. or to sunny areas, where you can't take a bulky camera? It's nice. Plus, it's survived me for 5 years. that's saying something. ;)

Reviews.Title: Old friend
Reviews.Author: PackerGal21
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 6 years ago for something to get me by until I could afford a "nicer" camera, but the camera was built to last. It was easy to use, pictures went easily to my laptop, and it took a good beating. The battery I bought with the camera at the time was the Lithium ion battery which I think had great life, and still does. My complaints are only these: The button that holds the battery in place, broke so I jimmy-rigged it with some glue; and second, everytime I put a memory card in the camera would read "locked" and not let me take pictures, even though the card was definitely not locked. So for the past 3 years I have been able to put in the memory card but not 'click' it into place, but just secure it with the little door at the bottom. It has been working great actually. Annoying, but I just dealt with it. The camera finally just died on me this week and I think I am planning on going out to find a new one. Hope I find another for as good of a price and quality as I did last time.

Reviews.Title: Snapshot a Go-Go
Reviews.Author: Samantha Motta
Reviews.Content: This camera was awesome for the price. Easy to use with a rechargeable battery. Not a lot of memory on the camera itself (it can hold about 25 pictures) so a memory card is highly recommended with its use. Only 7 megapixels though so I wouldn't recommend to someone looking for an extremely high-quality camera. Great camera to take every day pictures with.

Reviews.Title: the best yet
Reviews.Author: jeannie
Reviews.Content: I am visually impaired and this camera allowes me to take pictures I have always dreamed of taking.  I can't believe this is working so well.  with the combination of the zoom on the camera and the zoom text program on my computer i have the ability to take and edit pictures i never dreamed possible.I know this dosn't seem like much to most of  but to me it means so much. Next month when I go to get trained with my seeing eye dog, I will be able to take pictures and have them for my famiy and friends who cant be here with meit will mean so much.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: sweetie8
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Takes really good pictures, easy to operate. The seller was really great, answered all my questions. I would recommend this camera to anyone.  I had one just like this one, just a different color. I sold it to a friend and I purchased a Coolpix.  That camera is ok. but the picture quaility is not so good. I looked for a better camera and purchased a small kodack camera, didn't like the the digital zoom, not enough zoom. So, I decided to look for a camera just like I had before I sold it, because I knew the picture quaility was great, so I found this one and was so pleased to find one like the one I had earlier. This is really a great little camera, won't sell this one!!!!!

Reviews.Title: This HP Camera was used and broken
Reviews.Author: Dave Mortensen
Reviews.Content: This H P camera arrived in a damaged condition and was sent to me used. Am no happy. I returned it and want full credit.Than sucks to send me a used and broken camera.

Reviews.Title: An end to a wonderful era
Reviews.Author: S. Starkey "SRH1983"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 3 years now and have never had a problem.  I am seeking to upgrade due to being able to get more pixels for cheap.  Very sad HP no longer makes cameras.This camera has traveled everywhere with me.  He lives in my purse from day to day and has been great through it all.  My camera is still in great condition.  Any reviews saying they broke or the lens froze-that happens with every camera.  When you make a million of something, there will be a few with errors.I love the battery, the display, and the ease of use.  I can hand it to my mom who knows nothing about technology and she can figure it out.  Great little product I'm sad to see go!

Reviews.Title: Great camera Even batter then my sony t-300
Reviews.Author: Jagat Biswas
Reviews.Content: hey its a great camera for starter.take better picture then sony camera > believe me !video isnt the great but still its okits great for pictures and picture is really clear !

Reviews.Title: I like it too much
Reviews.Author: CF
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my camera, it's perfect for me. The photos has an excellent resolution, I can edited the red eyes in the camera after transfer it to the computer. The only negative thing is I can't listen the videos in the camera I have to transfers it first to the computer.

Reviews.Title: Best Choice for Me
Reviews.Author: Alice Robinson
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted a digital camera, and after much research found the HP R742 Photosmart to be the best deal for the money and product.  I originally wanted the Ruby Red, but I had Amazon bucks, and it wasn't available on Amazon yet. Turns out, color was not such a big deal, and the black one was a great choice. It is easy to use, and will not take the pic if you are out of focus or moving too much. The ease of downloading the images to my laptop is great and all of the camera functions are easy to use. I'm not a pro photographer, but I just can't take a bad picture thanks to HP R742.

Reviews.Title: HP R742 Photosmart Digital Camera (Black)
Reviews.Author: F. M. Sauciunas
Reviews.Content: This is my families third HP R742 digital camera. It is very easy to use. It has a rechargeable battery with charger. This 7 mega-pixel camera takes excellent pictures. It comes in different colors witch is great because everyone in my family had a different color camera.

Reviews.Title: HP Camera
Reviews.Author: Wendy R. Varrin
Reviews.Content: This camera is incredibly easy to use. The screen is larger than most digitals cameras so it makes it easier to see what you are shooting. To download or print pictues is simple. The cameera holds almost 1700 pictures with a 2MB card so you do not need to worry about running out.

Reviews.Title: Alright camera, marginal picture quality.
Reviews.Author: Bwicki "Brian"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera in red. The camera itself is alright. I wish it had a viewfinder as well as the screen. I do not like how fast the screen shuts off. The picture quality is marginal. Even in the steady photo mode, the picture is real grainy. In other modes such as night mode, you have to hold the camera real steady. I tried that and my pictures came out blurry. I wish I would have read reviews before purchasing this. Its an ok camera overall.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: Piano "Professor"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It feels substantial in my hands.  It isn't plastic at all.  Plus you can do video with sound, which I didn't expect.  This camera is extremely easy to use.  There are plenty of settings, and comes with great editing software.  Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, terrible software
Reviews.Author: Jeremy A. Thompson
Reviews.Content: HP make good cameras, but the HP photosmart software is awful. Trying to import photos, let alone print them is an arduous process and the software is not intuitive, or even logical. The software needs to be totally rethought. I will never buy another HP camera as a result.

Reviews.Title: worst cam you will ever have...!!!!
Reviews.Author: Naif Altahlawi
Reviews.Content: Very bad product, pictures are very dark, features are very limited, and for only 50 more dollars you can have a lot better camera. I strongly recommend to not have this camera under any circumstances. I love HP, but they are far away from other brands in doing Digital camers..!!Sorry HP......
